[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [State invariant] [Commitment-share binding] The relationship V[i] = g^C[i] must hold - can this be violated through manual field manipulation or unsafe deserialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Concurrency] [Concurrent verification] Multiple threads calling verify() with thread_rng() - can concurrent RNG access cause non-determinism or corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Concurrency] [Concurrent aggregation] aggregate_with() mutates self - can concurrent calls from multiple threads cause data races or state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Concurrency] [Concurrent maul_signature] Can maul_signature() be called concurrently with other operations, causing TOCTOU issues with dealer list? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Concurrency] [Shared transcript access] If Transcript is wrapped in Arc<RwLock<>>, can readers see partially aggregated state during write operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Protocol attack] [Selective abort] Can malicious dealers pass deal() and verify() but provide shares that fail threshold reconstruction, causing DKG abort? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Protocol attack] [Share inconsistency] Can a dealer provide shares that verify individually but are inconsistent with each other, breaking threshold reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/insecure_field/transcript.rs] [Protocol attack] [Grinding attack] Can attackers repeatedly call deal() with different RNG seeds until finding a weak transcript that passes verify()? (High)
